title: Space Development Agency still hoping to launch satellites next month, ‘but there’s risk’
summary: The Space Development Agency remains optimistic it will launch next month the first satellites of a planned mesh network of sensors and communications nodes in low Earth orbit

title: Apple lays the groundwork for emergency SOS via satellite service
summary: Apple said Nov. 10 its $450 million investment in an SOS via satellite service has helped Globalstar upgrade ground stations across the United States and elsewhere with high-power antennas.

title: Starlink launches donation website
summary: Starlink opened a donation page for customers who wish to donate a terminal and services to areas in need. In October, Elon...

title: Pioneering Astronaut Bob Behnken Retires from NASA
summary: NASA astronaut and former U.S. Air Force Col. Bob Behnken is retiring from NASA after 22 years of service. His last day with the agency is Friday, Nov. 11.

title: NASA to Brief Media on First Earth Water-Monitoring Satellite Mission
summary: NASA will host a virtual media briefing at 10:30 a.m. EST (7:30 a.m. PST) Nov. 14, at the agency’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Southern California, to discuss the upcoming launch of the Surface Water and Ocean Topography (SWOT) satellite.

title: Antenna developer NXT Comm’s assets up for sale
summary: Satellite antenna developer NXT Communications Corp.’s equipment, property, and other collateral are being auctioned off amid production delays that have left L3Harris Technologies in the lurch.

title: NASA leaves its Artemis I rocket exposed to winds above design limits
summary: NASA likely to begin inspections of the rocket and spacecraft later today.

title: NASA to continue Lunar Trailblazer despite cost overrun
summary: NASA will continue a lunar smallsat mission for launch in mid-2023 despite exceeding its cost cap by 30%.

title: Atlas 5 launches weather satellite, reentry tech demo mission
summary: An Atlas 5 successfully launched a polar-orbiting weather satellite and a reentry technology demonstrator on the final flight of the vehicle from California.

title: Atlas rocket bids farewell to California as ULA readies for Vulcan
summary: The Atlas rocket family, a staple of the US launch industry since June 11, 1957, is scheduled to end its West Coast operations on Nov. 10 with the launch of an Atlas V rocket with the JPSS-2 weather satellite.
